definition: (final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
(final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)

sentences.english: She planted little kisses across its forehead and it gurgled.
sentences.chinese: 她在它的额头上吻了几下，它咯咯地笑了。

sentences.english: The roosters on the farm say, "Cock-a-doodle-doo. ""
sentences.chinese: 农场里的公鸡说，“咯咯哒。”

sentences.english: A donation makes the cat cluck like a chicken.
sentences.chinese: 捐一笔钱便能让这只猫像鸡那样的咯咯叫。

sentences.english: A baby cries and gurgles but does not use articulate speech .
sentences.chinese: 婴儿仅啼哭和咯咯作声，却无法清晰的发音。

sentences.english: The professor chuckled when we told her that we were afraid of her.
sentences.chinese: 我们告诉教授我们有点怵她的时候她咯咯地笑了。

sentences.english: She'd giggled . Of what I'm going to think.
sentences.chinese: 她咯咯地笑开了，害怕不知道我会怎么想。

sentences.english: While reading them he chuckles into his beard.
sentences.chinese: 读这些诗的时候，他咯咯笑着。
他咯咯地笑着说，“开玩笑的。”

sentences.english: Each voice, rising and falling like the clamorous cackling of chickens.
sentences.chinese: 此起彼落的声音犹如小鸡咯咯的喧闹声。

sentences.english: The fire had crumbled down to greyness, and one of the lamps made a gurgling appeal for attention.
sentences.chinese: 炉火已经暗淡，一盏灯咯咯响着请求关照。

sentences.english: The baby sat in his high-chair,burbling happily.
sentences.chinese: 幼童坐在高脚椅里，发出咯咯声。

sentences.english: "No, it stalks me. " My young friend cackles .
A hen clucks lougly after it has laid an egg.
sentences.chinese: 一只母鸡下蛋后就咯咯叫。

sentences.english: When I told them what had happened to me, they all chortled with mirth.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的事告诉他们以后，他们全都咯咯地笑了。

sentences.english: I could hear the thug thudding about upstairs in his heavy boots.
sentences.chinese: 我听见凶手穿着沉重的靴子在楼上咯咯地走来走去。

sentences.english: He went on cackling and complaining about life.
sentences.chinese: 他继续咯咯地叫，不停地抱怨生活。

definition: to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to howl with laughter/to laugh one's head off
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
